Message.Title: Quad-Core HTC One X+ May Be Coming to T-Mobile
Message.Msg: http://gigaom.com/mobile/quad-core-htc-one-x-may-be-coming-to-t-mobile/

Topic.Title: Quad-Core HTC One X+ May Be Coming to T-Mobile

Message.Msg: T-Mobile HTC One X+ spotted on internal system – Tegra 3+ is a go http://www.intomobile.com/2012/07/25/tmobile-htc-one-x-spotted-internal-system-tegra-3-go/ Dates are always subject to change, but the photo above shows that we should be able to get our mits on the handset sometime in September, and T-Mobile likely has the iPhone 5 in its cross hairs with this phone. While the HTC One X+ for T-Mobile will likely lack LTE, which is fine by me, it should nonetheless prove to be a solid contender with anything on the market. We’re a couple of months away until we’ll likely see the handset materialize but a HTC One X with a Tegra 3+ inside is something to hold out of if you’re in the market for a smartphone.

Topic.Title: ZDNet just in: iPhone 5 delay worries surface

Message.Msg: http://messages.finance.yahoo.com/Business_%26_Finance/Investments/Stocks_(A_to_Z)/Stocks_N/threadview?bn=13029&tid=689334&mid=689347 "To all those who keep bashing qcom and aapl, I'll give you a what-if: what if qcom's lament about 28nm availability is aapl needed to hold up releasing their quad core iPhone5 so much because they both are waiting for enough 28nm qcom cheap radios. Not so easy to have 20M or more of those on hand at launch..... that's >>10x Nexus" again, for the nth time, nvda is not in the top two names in mobile. They are just fighting for table scraps. the whole tegra program is totally out of whack with the huge loss each quarter. All the extra out of sight r&d was to 'we'll release chips twice as fast as our competitors because we have parallel design teams in place'. That has totally fallen flat on its face.

Topic.Title: ZDNet just in: iPhone 5 delay worries surface

Message.Msg: I think you are judging to early. Nvidia has a clear mobile roadmap and is relatively new to this mobile game. But they are quick learners and will get stronger with each generation. I admit they have very strong opponents, but Nvidia is in it for the longer run and fight and might win on stamina down the road. I believe Nvidia will capture a strong place for itself in the market and that it will become more clear down the road. Just look back five years - who would have thought Nvidia would have come this far already. /Frank.

Topic.Title: ZDNet just in: iPhone 5 delay worries surface

Message.Msg: "I admit they have very strong opponents, but Nvidia is in it for the longer run and fight and might win on stamina down the road. " they are losing $100M/Q going up against two opponents who are making money during the fight..... and nvda's tegras are nothing that special compared to the Ax or Exynos either in performance nor in product introduction pace. Let's get real. IF nvda wants to stay in the game, they need to par back the program to something more sustainable.

Topic.Title: ZDNet just in: iPhone 5 delay worries surface

Message.Msg: T4 and project Denver are coming and look to be game changers.

Topic.Title: ZDNet just in: iPhone 5 delay worries surface

Message.Msg: Last I checked Tegra was showing up in a new mobile device every day. You guys get caught up in these performance debates. Look at what the market is doing, customers just want an affordable device with high quality graphics. The fact that you don't manufacture the fastest chip in all the world is irrelevant, its about business execution right now. Tegra us in the sweet spot.

Message.Title: earnings and guidance will be strong
Message.Msg: This quarter was transitional for them...A lot of the hurdles are not gone. 28nm shortages are lessening, google released the nexus and its selling every one it can make. Some of the new phones were launched with solid sales already. Going forward, as an investor, you have another possible big win in the kindle fire 2. I can't imagine them releasing and updated tablet that is not quad core...only nvidia has it right now and qualcom can barely make enough 28nm to fill current demand for s4 phones so that's not likely. TI has basically nothing to offer right now. Also, we are only about a quarter away for windows 8 and that is going to create quite a bit of buzz. I wonder how many GTX 670 and 680's they sold this quarter. Demand is still strong for these products and supply recently seems to be keeping up. These are high margin products. How many macbook's did apple sell..They said their sales were good. You can go on and on with all the products nvidia's chips are in and lots more are coming. The professional workstation market is still growing and they dominate that market. I think we get a decent run in the stock price leading to the release of the numbers. Its hard to imagine them missing their estimates and not having good guidance. The environment for them is as good as its going to get. If they can't capitalize now when they have the lead, not sure when they will have another opportunity this big. Its a big quarter for them.

Topic.Title: September Apples: Launch of iPhone 5 and iPad mini

Message.Msg: - So who's gonna plunk down their hard-earned cash for an Android-anything device -- without first checking out the fasmagorical Genuine Apple iPhone 5, or the revolutionary never-been-seen-before Genuine Apple iPad mini?
